ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals severe-to-profound loss in the right ear and moderate-to-profound loss in the left ear, consistent with history of trauma and family history.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss.
To assess speech detection and recognition abilities, particularly given the reported difficulty.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with progressive, bilateral, asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, significantly worse in the right ear (severe-to-profound) compared to the left (moderate-to-profound). Speech understanding is critically compromised, with no measurable word recognition in the right ear and very poor recognition (16%) in the left. Middle ear function is normal, but acoustic reflexes are largely absent due to the severity of the hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe sloping to profound SNHL (PTA 105 dB HL). Left ear: Moderate sloping to profound SNHL (PTA 82 dB HL). No measurable responses at 6-8 kHz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SAT 95 dB HL, WRS CNT. Left ear: SRT 70 dB HL, WRS 16% (very poor).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral/contralateral absent/artifact. Left ipsilateral present at 500 Hz (100 dB HL), absent 1000-4000 Hz. Left contralateral absent.

tests.name: Acoustic reflex decay
tests.result_summary: Could not be measured at 500 and 1,000 Hz due to absent contralateral acoustic reflex thresholds and artifacts.

proposed_items: New hearing aids with remote control
counseling_actions: Discuss cochlear implant evaluation due to severity of loss and poor speech scores
Counsel on limitations of traditional hearing aids given very poor word recognition (16%)
Advise on using visual cues and quiet environments for communication

escalation.rationale_short: Recommended for cochlear implant evaluation due to severe-to-profound loss and poor speech recognition, though patient initially declined.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor performance with new hearing aids and reconsider cochlear implant if patient becomes interested.

expected_outcome: Patient declined cochlear implant evaluation at the time of consultation.
Obtained new hearing aids with a remote control.
Patient reported doing well with the new hearing aids and hearing more soft sounds.
Used a telecoil to communicate on the telephone.
